quest.name: The Face of Thal
journal: First Sword Mylla has an urgent task for you.

One of your guildmates has been attacked by an unknown assailant and requires immediate assistance. Mylla bids you search for him at the Coffer & Coffin in central Thanalan and offer whatever assistance you can.

Though the potion is enough to save your comrade's life, it will take some time for him to make a full recovery. In the meantime, he asks you to find and speak with any witnesses in the vicinity, as well as search the point of ambush so that you can identify the assailant.
Your search yields a potential sighting, as well as a strange ring engraved with the likeness of a scorpion. Present your findings to the injured gladiator.

Believing the ring to be an important clue, the gladiator suggests that you show it to Wymond, an independent businessman known to possess knowledge on a wide variety of subjects. Speak with Wymond on the Steps of Nald in Ul'dah.
Wymond informs you that the ring is worn by members of the Alacran, a notorious criminal organization. Return to the Gladiators' Guild and tell Mylla everything you have learned.

Moments after you return to make your report, Aldis once again bursts into the guild, much to Mylla's chagrin. He admits that he is the target of the bounty hunters, and urges the guildmaster to leave the Alacran to him. However, Mylla refuses to heed his counsel and declares that the Gladiators' Guild will confront the bandits at the Silver Bazaar. Make your preparations for the coming battle and rendezvous with Mylla in western Thanalan.

After repelling the attackers, you and your comrades are confronted by more members of the Alacran, who are led by a man armed with a blade resembling Aldis's. While the encounter did not result in bloodshed, it has left Mylla shaken to the core. Return to the Gladiators' Guild and see if she is all right.

At the guild, Aldis explains that Leavold, his former Coliseum partner, has taken control of the Alacran and transformed them from a gang of common thieves into the most feared criminal organization in Thanalan. However, Mylla insists that the Leavold she once knew would never do such terrible things. As you witness the exchange between the two of them, you cannot help but wonder what terrible twist of fate tore the three friends apart seven long years ago.

※The next gladiator quest will be available from Mylla upon reaching level 25.
objectives: Aid the injured gladiator at the Coffer & Coffin in central Thanalan.
Find and speak with any witnesses.
Search the point of ambush for evidence.
Show the scorpion ring to Wymond in Ul'dah.
Rendezvous with Mylla at the Silver Bazaar in western Thanalan.
Speak with Mylla at the Gladiators' Guild.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Forename, I'm glad you're here! One of our members has been attacked and gravely wounded, and I need you to go and help him.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I suspect this is the work of more bounty hunters. It may even be a trap to lure more of us into the open. Nevertheless, we cannot ignore our comrade's plight.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: When last he contacted us by linkpearl, he said he'd try to seek shelter at the Coffer & Coffin. Take this potion and search for him there.

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: Help...help me... I can't feel my...

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: Thank you, sisterbrother. It all happened so fast...over by the tracks to the north. I don't know who attacked me, nor why they left me alive, but I daresay the answer is out there. Surely, someone saw something.

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: I don't remember anything myself, but I'm sure someone nearby saw something. Could you speak with the local residents and see what they know? The place I was attacked might also be worth a look.

dialogue.name: NPC
dialogue.text: Suspicious characters? Well, now that you mention it, I did see a strange fellow wearing a garish purple robe. At first, I thought he was talking to himself, but then I realized he had a linkpearl. I heard him say something about the “wrong man” and the “Silver Bazaar.” Does that help?

dialogue.name: NPC
dialogue.text: The fellow outside? Aye, I saw him stumble in when I left the bar to take a piss. Was alone as I recall. Ye say he's wounded? Thought he was just drunk!

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text:
<cough> Purple robe? Hmmm, that sounds familiar...
Aye, it was him, I'd swear it. Did you find anything else?

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: Picked this up by the tracks, eh? Might well have belonged to the bastard. Can't say I've seen its like before.

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: Might be as Wymond could tell you more. You know him, don't you? He's the bespectacled bloke who's always lounging around Emerald Avenue in the city. 'Course, being the businessman that he is, he'll probably ask to be compensated in exchange.

dialogue.name: GUILDMEMBER
dialogue.text: Show that ring to Wymond. He's sure to know something about it.

dialogue.name: WYMOND
dialogue.text: Well now, if it ain't Forename, everybody's favorite 'venturer! I hear you threw your lot in with the gladiators─a questionable decision, given the events of recent days, but to each his own. To what do I owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: WYMOND
dialogue.text: Oi, put that away before someone sees it! Where in the seven hells'd you get one of those rings!?

dialogue.name: WYMOND
dialogue.text: What, don't you recognize the sigil? <sigh> Godsdamned fool. Before you go stumblin' around in the brush, you ought to at least know what kind of venomous bastards'll be lurkin' within.

dialogue.name: WYMOND
dialogue.text: Been a long time since Ul'dah's seen a criminal organization rise from obscurity to notoriety as quickly as the Alacran. Word is they've got connections to the Brass Blades, the Syndicate, an' gods know who else.

dialogue.name: WYMOND
dialogue.text: But you didn't hear that from me. I want no part of whatever mess you an' your mates have gotten yourselves into. Understood?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename! I was wondering when you might return. What news do you bring of our injured comrade?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He was attacked by a member of the Alacran.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: His attackers may be headed to the Silver Bazaar.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The Alacran? I find that hard to believe─but no matter.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The Silver Bazaar!? Then it must be the same gang of ruffians!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: One of our comrades returned from Stonesthrow moments ago. A gang of bandits is said to be headed for the Silver Bazaar. They're after a man with an enormous bounty on his head.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The people living there are in grave danger. In their frenzy to find their quarry, the bandits won't scruple to destroy property and harm civilians, and the few Brass Blades stationed there will be powerless to stop them.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: We must stop them, Forename. We'll protect the Silver Bazaar and avenge our injured guildmate, all in one fell swoop!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: A bit melodramatic, if you ask me.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Aldis!? I told you never to come here again!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: I couldn't sit idly by while you charge into battle against an enemy you know nothing about. Mylla, a responsible guildmaster would never risk the lives of her charges like this.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Who are you to lecture me about responsibility!?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Mylla, listen to me─this is the Alacran you're dealing with.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: So? Whatever notoriety they may have achieved means nothing to me. We'll cut them down like the common bandits they are.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: It's not that simple. More importantly, it's not your fight.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: What are you saying?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: They want me, Mylla. I've been fending off assassination attempts ever since I returned to Thanalan.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Just stay here and let me handle this. It'll be over soon, I promise.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: ...Just stay here while you go off on your own, is that it?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: It's been seven years since I let you leave, Aldis. Seven years. Do you have any idea─any idea at all what you put me through?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Mylla...

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I don't want to hear it, you selfish bastard! Do you even care about the people who suffered because of you? Just...just get out─we don't need your help! We'll settle this ourselves!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Mylla, wait! There's something you need to know─

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Enough! Get out, get OUT!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: All right, all right. Save some of that for the Alacran. But do try not to let Forename here come to harm while you're at it.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: What are you waiting for!? You have your orders, now go!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename! Everyone's already in position! Are you prepared?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Rejoice, gladiators, for the day is ours!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Hm!?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: What!? But...but why would you be─

dialogue.name: NPCA
dialogue.text: Leave 'em to us, First Sword!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: No, stop!

dialogue.name: ZANA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Such brittle blades, so easily broken. Perhaps the First Sword is made of stronger steel.

dialogue.name: REHWOLDT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Leave her, Zana. Our business here is over.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: What...what have you done, Leavold...?

dialogue.name: NPCA
dialogue.text: First Sword, we must withdraw! The wounded need tending! Let us take them back to the guild!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Give me a moment, Forename. I need to think...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: I wanted to spare you this, Mylla. I begged you not to go.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: You knew, Aldis? That...that Leavold had...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Leavold and I once fought side by side in the Coliseum─the Twin Swords of Nald'thal, they called us. Never lost a match, honored by the Bull of Ala Mhigo himself─but that was then and this is now.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: When I learned Leavold single-handedly transformed the Alacran from a gang of common thieves into the most feared criminal organization in Thanalan, I knew I had to return.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: It seems like a lifetime ago that the three of us used to train together in this hall...

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The Leavold I knew would never stoop so low. He was a good man, strong and true! What would drive him to do this?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: When I find him, I'll be sure to ask. Unfortunately, he seems determined to kill me for my curiosity.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: What aren't you telling me, Aldis?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: I'm not clever enough to keep secrets, my dear. I'm a simple man, only capable of dealing with what's right in front of me.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Is that so...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: I'll find him, Mylla. I promise.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next gladiator quest will be available from Mylla upon reaching level 25.

dialogue.name: SCENE00020
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“CLSGLA200”?

dialogue.name: SCENE00020
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: SCENE00020
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the Alacran henchmen!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Stay focused! Choose your target and finish him!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The conjurers are the greater threat! The others can wait!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Forename, deal with them!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Thaumaturges!? Gods, I've always hated mages...

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Finish them, before they can cast again!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Damn you, I'll...ugh!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: First Sword...I'm sorry...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ugh... We must...p-protect...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Nobody makes me bleed my own─ugh!
